vulnerability_location.description: Hard-coded address check allows an attacker to reassign Owner without prior authorization and then withdraw all funds
Low-level call via adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking the returned success flag

The contract uses .transfer() to send the entire balance to Owner (and then to msg.sender). If Owner (or msg.sender) is a contract whose fallback reverts or consumes more than 2300 gas, these transfers will always fail and revert the call, locking the contract balance and making these functions unusable.
Use of low-level adr.call.value(msg.value)(data) without checking return value, allowing reentrancy or unexpected failures in external calls
